page.title: 02MARKET RASEN-LOCAL HISTORY 1
page.content: From its early beginnings as a tiny hamlet in the 11th. century, Market Rasen has become the most important settlement of the three bearing the name Rasen(from the word meaning a plank bridge). The present village of Middle Rasen was originally the 'mother' settlement, Rasen Media. It was not until 1180 that Rasen Parva became a parish in its own right. The church of St. Thomas was confirmed to the Priory of Sixhills in 1189. Just after this the power to hold a market at East Rasen, as it was now called, was given in 1219 as it was a suitable distance from other markets. By 1400 the name of Market Rasen was in use and the village had become a centre for the wool trade although Middle Rasen had double the population(200 in Market Rasen)
